summary:
Experience working in statistical applications for educational data, recommendation systems, marketing, credit, and health area.

Academic experience in epidemiological studies, cancer research, biological projects, population-based studies, market research, and governmental studies. Research experience in time series analysis, Bayesian inference, and Monte Carlo methods. Recent research involves inference methods for state-space models.

Academic training in statistical methods and economics/econometrics.  Good math and programming skills.

awards.title: 2nd place - National Economics Olympiad (NEO)
awards.description: NEO (https://www.nationaleconomicsolympiad.org/) is a problem-solving competition for Bachelor and Master students in Economics, organized by the study association AEclipse and the Royal Dutch Economic Association (KVS) in close collaboration with Erasmus School of Economics and the Dutch Journal on Policy Economics (ESB).
awards.issuer: Royal Dutch Economic Association (KVS) and AEclipse

awards.title: Best undergraduate research project
awards.description: Awarded at the graduation ceremony for having the highest grade in a research project within the 2019-1 cohort.
awards.issuer: Direção de pesquisa e pós-graduação - ESAG/UDESC

awards.title: Best Student Award
awards.description: Received all travel expenses to participate at the ANPEC National Meeting for having the highest GPA among the 2017 graduate student's cohort.

awards.title: Best Poster Presentation
awards.description:
Best Poster Award at the XXIVth International Biometric Conference, held in Dublin, Ireland.
Title:  Correlation between Claus, Gail and Tyrer-Cuzick models in a population-based cohort study.
https://www.biometricsociety.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/JulSept08.pdf

projects.title: QEdu
projects.description: O QEdu é o maior portal de Informações Educacionais do Brasil, exibindo de forma amigável, dados do Censo Escolar e da Prova Brasil para todas as escolas e municípios do País. O QEdu é aberto e gratuito, construído através de uma parceria da Meritt com a Fundação Lemann.

profile_positions.description:
Teaching Assistant in the following courses:
Introduction to Data Science [graduate] (2021-22, 2022-23), Academic Skills [undergraduate] (2021-22), Advanced Programming [undergraduate] (2022-23). Supervisor and co-reader of Bachelor's thesis in the Econometrics and the Double Degree in Economics and Econometrics programs. 

Member of the PhD student council.
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. Candidate (Econometrics)

profile_positions.description: Research Assistant for dr. Andreas Pick (Econometrics Institute).
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Student representative at the Educational Board of Tinbergen Institute for the TI and the Business Data Science MPhil programs. The Educational Board issues advice, both solicited and unsolicited, to the Director of Graduate Studies on all matters concerning the educational program, with the objective of maintaining or improving the quality of the program. Student representatives conduct surveys among the current cohorts, propose policies and advice based on course evaluations and actively participate on all board matters.
profile_positions.title: Educational Board Member

profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: The Ph.D. council at ESE represents the Ph.D. candidates from all departments of the Erasmus School of Economics. We help to build the community of PhDs, think of strategies for supporting the Ph.D.'s wellbeing, and work closely with the doctoral office in improving the doctoral program.

company.name: Instituto Da Mama Do Rio Grande Do Sul

volunteer_experiences.description: Worked in events to raise funds for the institute and also give for general public information about breast cancer prevention and early detection.

EPAR represents all (aspiring) PhD candidates of the Erasmus University, including the Erasmus Medical Centre, as well as early career researchers and all others who feel part of the Rotterdam PhD community. We cooperate with the PhD councils from all faculties to give current and aspiring PhD candidates a face and a voice at the university level. EPAR provides information for PhD candidates, maintains contacts with the university's policy makers and organises drinks and other events to bring together and support the community.
